originalText.text: Medically they’re one of the best but staff is really messed up alot of favoritism here also place is riddled with mice and rats and water bugs…. Especially down in short stay where babies are…

originalText.text:
I just wanted to review this organization after interning there for 5 weeks. This place does incredible work! I saw first hand how they really care for their patients and strive to make sure that they have the support they need. The staff is super nice and really takes care of the patients. They have a variety of programs there to help. They also have a variety of programs and a very comprehensive vocational program too. They work hard to help their patients get better and develop the skills they need. New York needs more places like them.
Disclaimer: I was not asked to write this. These opinions are my own that i thought I should share after interning there for a couple of weeks and being exposed to the work they do.

originalText.text: If you're looking for a drug-free environment, this is not the place to be. This is the kind of place where clients have easy access to all types of drugs. All they have to do is go for a small stroll and they can get whatever drug they're looking for. At this establishment, clients can buy drugs without any hassles or complications. The lack of regulation allows customers to get whatever types of drugs they want, easily and without consequence. This is not a place I would recommend for anyone looking to stay away from drugs. There is too much risk involved with easy access to all types of drugs. There can be serious health and legal implications associated with such easy access to drugs, and the possible consequences greatly outweigh any potential benefits.

originalText.text: I’ve never personally been to this facility nor has my father (who will hopefully be there soon) but I have personally been to many other years ago and although I am sober today for many years,l and have worked in a few treatment facilities,  I did not have the greatest experience with any facilities in NY.  However, just from speaking to Sabrina in admissions on the phone trying to secure a bed for my father, I had a wonderful experience with her.  I don’t know much about this place or any other workers there but Sabrina  was very helpful and sweet on the phone.  Hopefully everyone else there is just like her!

originalText.text: the worst director/ceo non counselor ever to exist. left me homeless on a bogus swab for alcohol after the entire facility stuck up for me. refused to retest and waited 13 days to tell me and kick me out with a list of shelters not from nyc. lucky by most accounts to be alive. stay away
